result.execSummary:
The defendant Lontrell Lee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence.  Release to the Day Reporting Center only.  Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.

miscConds.notes: Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including the DNA surcharge.  To be paid to probation agent. Any cash bail to apply.  Any remaining balance at the end of probation will be due immediately or an entry of a civil judgment.
Full time work, school or a combination of both.

Provide DNA sample if ot already done so.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: firearm possession and voting.

Maintain absolute sobriety. Not to pssess or use any controlled substances unless by valid prescription.
No possession of any drug paraphernalia including any packaging materials for personal use or for manufacturing or delivering drugs in the community.
No firearms or weapons.
No possession of cash greater than $200.00 coins and/or bills.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lontrell Lee

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 
Defendant sentenced to serve 8 months in the House of Correction, release to the Day Reporting Center ONLY, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 4 days time served.  Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months. 
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant NOT possess or
  use any controlled substances unless by valid prescription.
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia including any packaging
  materials for personal use or for manufacturing or delivering drugs in the 
  community.
- No firearms or weapons. 
- No possession of cash greater than $200.00, coins and/or bills.
- Full time work, school or a combination of both. 
- Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the 
  DNA surcharge to paid to the probation agent.  Any cash bail 
  on deposit to apply. Any remaining balance at the end of 
  probation will be due immediately or an entry of a civil judgment.
- Pay all Department of Correction supervision fees.
- Defendant to provide DNA sample if not already done so. 


Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 
Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
signed Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement.

Defendant Lontrell Lee in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information. Judgment of conviction entered.
Justice Point Pretrial Report dated September 2, 2014, received and filed.

Defendant Lontrell Lee in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for Plea and Sentencing. Defense requests adjournment for reasons placed on the record. State does not object to an adjournment. 
Court orders case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing on 9-3-2014 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Report dated August 15, 2014, received and filed.
Positive drug screen; will provide verification of prescription on 7-28-14.  No action taken.

Parties advised that effective 8-3-14, case will be reassigned to Judge Stark, Br. 17, in room 313 of the safety building.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lontrell Lee in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Lontrell Lee in custody.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.
